data.title: Why the DS and PSP Suck
data.meta_description: The folks at Modojo love handheld gaming enough to specialize in it, but with that much love comes an equal amount of hate, and thus we have their list of ten things they hate about the DS and PSP, five apiece. I’m largely in agreement with the whole thing–that analog nub is enough to make […]
data.text:
The folks at Modojo love handheld gaming enough to specialize in it, but with that much love comes an equal amount of hate, and thus we have their list of ten things they hate about the DS and PSP, five apiece. I'm largely in agreement with the whole thing--that analog nub is enough to make me want to kick things--but I do quibble with a few of their choices, specifically the "Quirky Titles" complaint for the DS:

I like quirky games and innovation just as much as the next guy. I love digital comic-type graphic adventures. Warioware Touched is genuinely fun for about 45 minutes. It's just that, sometimes, I want to play an adrenaline-fueled racer or a baseball game. Unfortunately, if that's your cup of tea, you may be sorely disappointed. Nintendo's handheld entry offers unparalleled panache - but not as much palpitation.

Now, I understand what he's saying, but given that every other console out there is positively choking on the non-quirky types of games he's craving, I don't feel at all sorry that he can't play Juiced on his DS. When we start getting our choice of titles like Touch Detective, Hotel Dusk, or Electroplankton on other platforms, then I'll start bemoaning the "limited" range of DS offerings. Until then, I shed no tears.

10 Things I Hate About You [Modojo]

He Made a Movie About Humans Rising Up Against AI. Now He’s Doing the Real Thing

Mike Rianda’s The Mitchells vs. the Machines is a sci-fi comedy about a family fighting back against Silicon Valley tech. As animators gear up to battle Hollywood studios, it’s becoming a fable.

Six-Word Sci-Fi: Stories Written by You

Here's this month's prompt, how to submit, and an illustrated archive of past favorites.

How World of Warcraft Devs Launched One of the Biggest Unions in Video Games

Microsoft’s acquisition of Activision Blizzard created an environment that helped workers. Amid layoffs and worries about AI, their efforts could be an indicator of the future of the industry.

The 30 Best Movies on Max (aka HBO Max) Right Now

Love Lies Bleeding, Dune: Part Two, and Beetlejuice are just a few of the movies you should be watching on Max this month.

Assassin’s Creed Shadows and How ‘DEI’ Became Gamergate 2.0’s Rallying Cry

The forthcoming game’s inclusion of a Black samurai named Yasuke has caused a controversy in the gaming world, one that has a familiar ring to it.

Gamergate’s Aggrieved Men Still Haunt the Internet

Ten years ago, much of the frustrations gamers were expressing came from anger over no longer being the target audience. Now those feelings are everywhere, from fandom to politics.

Twitch’s New DJ Program Has Flaws, But It’s the Best There Is

Twitch is finally giving DJs a place to get paid for streaming their sets—and compensate the artists they spin. Its limited catalog of songs and opaque earnings plan may leave some streamers cold.

The 36 Best Shows on Amazon Prime Right Now

The Boys, Batman: Caped Crusader, and Fallout are just a few of the shows you should be watching on Amazon Prime Video this week.
